data: The country is so much larger than the city and so empty that you rattle around in it until you wonder if you are ever going to get stuck to any place, especially if there isnâ€™t a house numbered anywhere.

The country is so much larger than the city and so empty that you rattle around in it until you wonder if you are ever going to get stuck to any place, especially if there isn't a house numbered anywhere.
Daviess, Maria Thompson, 1872-1924; Johnson, Percy D. [Illustrator]
